channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken fence, 22nd December
item.description:
The tree has forced the fence out onto the pavement causing a very nasty trip hazard. Which could result in a serious injury to a member of the public

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 276, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several Potholes on both sides of the road., 22nd December
item.description:
There are several potholes that have appeared over the last week on stretch of Totteridge Lane between St Margaret's Avenue and Totteridge & Whetstone Tube station.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Totteridge Lane, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely large and deep pothole, 22nd December
item.description:
The pothole is at least 1m diameter and 50cm deep with road debris from the tarmac all over the road. It is on the stretch of Friary Road after Friary Way near the brook in the direction towards Friern Barnet Lane. There are several potholes on Friary Road between Friary Way and Friern Barnet Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Friary Road, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandon shopping trolley, 22nd December
item.description:
Abandon shopping trolley on street, between 42 and 40 Hassett Road. (I did not received a link and I did check my spam email folder nothing to trying again)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hassett Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old wet decomposed leaves, 22nd December
item.description:
Main road SIDCUP As you come out of the crescent to the right the road is covered with old decomposing leaves. They are stuck in the path They are covering the path and are very slippery. Can they be removed please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light not working on alley between Letchworth Close and Beadon Road, 22nd December
item.description:
The light in the middle of the alley is not working, making the alley dark and dangerous at night. The leds are on very dimly, not enough to provide any real light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Beadon Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 street lights on 27/7 for last 3 weeks, 22nd December
item.description:
3 Street lights in Bidborough Close and one in Barnhill Avenue have been on 24/7 for 3 plus weeks. Light ID B-88-4, B-99-1, B-99-3, B- 99-3.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bidborough Close, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags from gutter clearing up and down Madeline road, 22nd December
item.description:
The street gutters in Madeline road where cleared early last week but the bags are still on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Madeline Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping not being removed, 22nd December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Elswick Road, Ladywell, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Leaf tipping!, 22nd December
item.description:
The leaves need to be collected (they were too heavy to transport anywhere else) Of note, Point Hill isn’t in your leaf clearing schedules. It’s a very steep street, one of the steepest in Greenwich and wet leaves are hazardous. Please can you review next year

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Point Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
